name: Comfort Hotel London Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I recently returned from a very long flight, exhausted.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good value, helpful and friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had booked the Comfort Hotel over the internet from abroad and had paid a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Noisy doors!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived (quite late at night), we were met by two very friendly and helpful male receptionists. They advised us that we would be able to stay a little later than the normal check out time, if needed, to recover from our long trip and there would be no extra charge. This was welcome news! They also upgraded our room to a superior room free of charge!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for Heathrow and TOP manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and we slept well.
reviews.title: Perfect for an overnight in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning I called down to reception to ask about the Hoppa buses back to the airport and again, received nothing but polite and helpful advice.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As airport hotels go, this was a good choice. The best feature was the size of the rooms: no falling over suitcases on the way to the bathroom. We arrived late and left early so did not sample much in the way of amenities. We got a good price on the hotel website and I was particularly interested in the 'Exclusive Breakfast Deal" , all for a very reasonable £45. However, when I pointed this out to the reception I was informed that I had mis-read the offer and that "exclusive breakfast deal" meant that breakfast was not included. This I found a bit misleading!! Maybe I was just expecting too much. The wait for the shuttle bus in the evening was a bit long (30 mins; none after 23.00) and for £4 each, we could have taken a cab and avoided the scenic tour of the other hotels on the way.
reviews.title: A good value and comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Comfort Hotel states that you have access to the Hoppa Bus shuttle service to and from LHR airport. This is not a free shuttle service, you must pay 4 Pound per person each time you get on the bus. If you have 4 or more people with you, you can book a limo for 15 Pound through the hotel front desk, it's quicker and easier to get to the terminal. You must book the night before you need the limo.
reviews.title: Shuttle service and dinner voucher info

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfort Hotel offers a special coupon for their dinners at their resturant. It sounds like a great deal. However, what the front desk don't tell you is that only the items listed on the dinner menu with a small red star are eligible for the discount. You have to purchase the coupon in advance at the Front Desk before entering their resturant.
reviews.title: Clean and presentable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff is excellent and the room are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Cheap room, everything else a ripoff
Ideal for "our" needs
reviews.text: Pre-booked over the internet, so was very inexpensive compared to if you just walked in off the street. Secure, paid parking available. A bit hard to find, especially after 24 hours travel, but not too far from Heathrow. Shower sprayed everywhere. Ordered room service, prompt, but person who took the call was blunt and hung up before we could ask how long it would take.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked through Legoland and paid £40 for room, breakfast (for 3) and car parking - so excellent price - especially for eat as much as you want breakfast. However we booked a family room and arrived to find the sofabed folded down and made up - a relief since we arrived late - but there was no room to walk to the window as the sofabed met the main bed in the middle of the room. Certainly would not have wanted to use the room during the day. Traffic noise predominated overnight.
reviews.title: Convenient, cheap and clean. But noisy and no floor space.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: 10 minutes drive to Heathrow Terminal-3. Fairly large, clean and fairly-furnished rooms providing quite and comfortable sleep. Has a humble restaurant with modest if somewhat pricy food. The hotel staff at reception, bar and restuarant were nice and helpful - no complaints there.
reviews.title: Airport hotel... Not more, not less...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: If what you look for is a single night's stay nearby Heathrow without spending a fortune, this would hotel would be enough to fulfill the task.
reviews.title: Service - forget it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I am currently in the Comfort Hotel and I am disgusted in the service!!!!
reviews.title: Fine for a one night stay to travel out of Heathrow Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We should not have bothered and I am tempted to check out!!!
reviews.title: Handy for the airport, clean, but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Made booking directly with hotel for single night as another 7 days spent in downtown.Easy and very simple booking process. BIG single room for 40 GBP only. With payment on site is over 100. Full english breakfast with great choice comparing to overpriced next hotel where we stayed (with no choice at all) for 7.5 GBP.
reviews.title: Great value for little money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Not really new but very good for this price.
reviews.title: A lack of comfort

likes.liked: — The food in the restaurant, although a rather small portion, was delicious.
likes.disliked: — The constant disturbances and the inability to get a good night's sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bathroom amenities limited but sufficient. Good choice of TV channels. Excellent connection to Hetrow terminals via shuttle bus (4 GBP)
reviews.title: I would stay somewhere else in London...

likes.liked: — That it was relatively close to the airport.
likes.disliked: — That there was not a reliable wireless Internet connection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You may like the Comfort Hotel; you may not. It all depends on how you define 'comfort', really. If your definition is loose enough to tolerate...
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel but rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Constant dripping from each of the bathroom taps as well as the shower-head.
reviews.title: Garbage!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: My mother had an early flight the following day and we found this a very convenient location for the airport. It is a very busy hotel but we were treated with great courtesy by the staff. The room was more than adequate and we both had a good nights sleep. Our wake up call was prompt and checking out was done with ease. Very good value for money and we would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: A very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Basic hotel, pretending to be something its not, think Travelodge with a better reception and smaller room. The room I stayed in was dated, crack in the sink, window wouldn't close properly, You must use web to book and pay for room as the advertised rate at recption was £175 per night , you would be crazy to pay this, Tripadvisor was cheapest you have to check all the advisor offered sites.
reviews.title: A functional basic hotel, small room, the cost on Tripadvisor was cheapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was pretty good although at the time I arrived they were dealing with difficult "Crew" that wanted something for nothing!!
reviews.title: Missed flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having missed returned flight to belfast we booked into hotel via Hotel reservation desk at heathrow. £100 room only. Bright, clean and hospital staff. Reasonable priced restarunt and bar snacks. Served by Bus Hoppa service to Heathrow. Useful for use for overnight stay for connecting flight next day. can be booked cheaper in advance.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Feel a bit let down by this hotel, I know it's busy but it could feel a lot less rushed, and it has a outdated feel to it. However it's fine for a stay before an early Heathrow departure and the hoppa was very reasonable (£4 each way) and reliable. The hotel food is very overpriced, we found it much better to drive a few minutes to a local curry house.
reviews.title: Poor stay - would'nt stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the more cost effective options in the LHR area.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Did not have my voucher when I got to the desk so asked to use computer to print - a bit of a faff, having to pay for internet access, emailing it to the front desk and having them print it out for me. They allowed me to run off my Itinerary/ vouchers for the rest of my holiday which I appreciated.
reviews.title: Terrible service at front desk - will never be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think life would be made easier if internet access wasn't charged by the half hour for such instances as the guests who needed to use it after me twigged the code was still valid and needed to pay nothing. Also, if the printer was more easily accesible to guests- meaning less time taken up by me for their front desk staff.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were as you would expect for an airport hotel, tea and coffee, kettle etc.. in room.
reviews.title: GOOD VALUE STOPOVER FOR HEATHROW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and comfortable, beds lovely, all sheets very clean.
reviews.title: Very Good Value for Heathrow/London Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is inexpensive and comfortable.. Not classy or anything special but then we paid a very reasonable room price. Using expedia.
reviews.title: Comfortable, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the night before our holiday as we had an early flight from heathrow, food was good, reception check in was quick and easy, room was basic, bed, tv wardrobe and shower/bath but very clean, a great for a one nighter stay.
reviews.title: Has gone downhill badly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the hotels shuttle bus service to the terminals which is only 10-15 mins ride away, they ran at regular times and were very easy to book from reception.
reviews.title: Cheap & Cheerful - Good Deal For £70 Inc 15 Days Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free Internet connection in the lounge area, good bar and lounge facilities.
reviews.title: Pretty good stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Again this hotel is Basic - possibly on par with a typical travel lodge, cant fault it as you get what you pay for. It was ideal for what we needed and we would stay here again for the same purpose.
reviews.title: Not Bad, So little time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we found the receptionist not very friendly. However we were pleased with the room for the price we paid. The room was allocated on the ground floor which we found to be quiet, a bit on the small size but adequate for the one night, though the beds were a bit hard! We booked through Holiday Extras and had a deal that included a 3 course evening meal. There was a varied selection on the menu , the prices reasonable for a hotel and the restaurant staff were very friendly. For an additional £9.95pp we had a full english breakast offering quite a good choice. Overall we felt the hotel had a friendly warm atmosphere.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for an early morning flight from Heathrow the next day and I couldn't really fault it. The rooms were good, it was clean, the staff friendly and all very cheap for the cost. Clearly not somewhere for a romantic weekend but as a quick obernight stop close to the airport it was absolutely ideal.
reviews.title: Good for cheap one-nighter that's close to Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: No airs and graces about this place. It is a clean and comfortable hotel that is ideal if you're travelling in/out of Heathrow. The Heathrow Hoppa serves the hotel and airport terminals and I found it cheap and efficient.
reviews.title: Good budget hotel for travelling out of Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the price we paid (£85 for one night and 15 days parking) we didn't expect any luxury, but certainly didn't expect to encounter the most ignorant and incapable staff imaginable. One female member of staff was excellent however everything she did was constantly criticised by the other male staff members.
reviews.title: Hotel OK - Staff rude, incapable and ignorant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival it was clear we had to leave our car keys behind with the hotel staff - we did not agree to this prior to our arrival, but were forced to do so. Every customer who checked in was told that there was a special offer on; £14.99 for two courses from the dinner menu, what the staff failed to mention was that this was limited to all but the most basic of dishes. Furthermore, the staff seemed to have a habit of wanting to take your credit card to place everything on the room. Even when I explained that we had paid for dinner in cash and were checking out at 4am did we have a real struggle to prevent them taking an imprint of the card.
reviews.title: I Didn't Have a Problem

description: change Primary photo from ownerphoto edit
